references.paper_title: Unsupervised learning of visual features by contrasting cluster assignments
references.reason: This paper introduces the contrastive learning framework, a core concept in self-supervised learning which is heavily analyzed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, another core concept in multimodal learning which is heavily analyzed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Efficient estimation of linear functionals of a probability measure P with known marginal distributions
references.reason: This paper provides foundational theoretical results on the estimation of probability distributions with known marginals, which are directly relevant to the analysis of data balancing in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Auxiliary information: The raking-ratio empirical process
references.reason: This paper provides important prior theoretical results on the analysis of data balancing and related estimators, which are directly relevant to the target paper.

references.paper_title: Diagonal equivalence to matrices with prescribed row and column sums
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sinkhorn-Knopp algorithm, a fundamental algorithm in matrix scaling and optimal transport that is closely related to data balancing and is discussed in the target paper.
